questiontext.text:
Find the eigenvalues and the associated eigenvectors of the following matrix:

$$\small A = \begin{pmatrix}-2 &4 &-3 \\-10 &6 &-5 \\-8 &-9 &1\end{pmatrix}\:$$

Calculate upto 3 significant figures and answer in increasing order $$\small\lambda_{1}\leq\lambda_{2}\leq\lambda_{3}$$

EigenValues:

$$\small \lambda_{1} = $${1:NUMERICAL:=-5.6937:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}  $$\small \lambda_{2} = $${1:NUMERICAL:=3.1783:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}  $$\small \lambda_{3} = $${1:NUMERICAL:=7.5153:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}

Associated EigenVectors:

$$\small V_{1} = k_{1}\begin{pmatrix}v_{1,1}\\v_{1,2}\\v_{1,3}\end{pmatrix}\:$$   $$\small V_{2} = k_2\begin{pmatrix}v_{2,1}\\v_{2,2}\\v_{2,3}\end{pmatrix}\:$$   $$\small V_{3} = k_3\begin{pmatrix}v_{3,1}\\v_{3,2}\\v_{3,3}\end{pmatrix}\:$$

Specify the answer as a unitory vector where $$\small v_{1,1}$$ , $$\small v_{2,1}$$ and $$\small v_{3,1}$$ are positive. In case $$\small v_{1,1}$$ , $$\small v_{2,1}$$ or $$\small v_{3,1}$$ are negative , you can multiply all the elements of the matrix by -1 to make them positive. If $$\small v_{1,1} = 0$$ , $$\small v_{2,1} = 0$$ or $$\small v_{3,1} = 0$$ then check and make sure that $$\small v_{1,2}$$ , $$\small v_{2,2}$$ or $$\small v_{3,2}$$ is given as positive respectively. If $$\small v_{1,1} = v_{1,2} = 0$$ , $$\small v_{2,1} = v_{2,2} = 0$$ or $$\small v_{3,1} = v_{3,2} = 0$$ then check and make sure that $$\small v_{1,3}$$ , $$\small v_{2,3}$$ or $$\small v_{3,3}$$ is given as positive respectively.

$$\small V_{1} = k_{1}$$  
{1:NUMERICAL:=0.15475:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}
{1:NUMERICAL:=0.49734:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}
{1:NUMERICAL:=0.85364:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}
  
   
$$\small V_{2} = k_{2}$$  
{1:NUMERICAL:=0.40923:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}
{1:NUMERICAL:=-0.14575:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}
{1:NUMERICAL:=-0.90071:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}
  
   
$$\small V_{3} = k_{3}$$  
{1:NUMERICAL:=0.39442:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}
{1:NUMERICAL:=0.28244:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}
{1:NUMERICAL:=-0.87445:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}

generalfeedback.text:
In order to find the eigenvalues we look at characteristic equation $$\small det(A - \lambda I_{3}) = 0$$ where $$\small I_{3}$$ is a 3x3 identity matrix]

$$\small det(A - \lambda I_{3}) = \begin{vmatrix}-2-\lambda &4 &-3 \\-10 &6-\lambda &-5 \\-8 &-9 &1-\lambda\end{vmatrix}\: = 0 $$

Solving the determinant we get ,

$$\small \lambda_{1} =-5.6937$$  $$\small \lambda_{2} =3.1783$$  $$\small \lambda_{3} =7.5153$$

The associated eigenvectors can be calculated as follows:

$$\small (A - \lambda_{1} I_{3})V_{1} = 0$$  ,  $$\small (A - \lambda_{2} I_{3})V_{2} = 0$$  and  $$\small (A - \lambda_{3} I_{3})V_{3} = 0$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{1}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}-2 - (-5.6937) &4 &-3 \\-10 &6 - (-5.6937) &-5 \\-8 &-9 &1 - (-5.6937) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{1,1} \\v_{1,2} \\v_{1,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}3.6937 &4 &-3 \\-10 &11.6937 &-5 \\-8 &-9 &6.6937\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{1,1} \\v_{1,2} \\v_{1,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{1,1} = \frac{v_{1,1}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{1,2} = \frac{v_{1,2}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{1,3} = \frac{v_{1,3}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{1}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{1} = k_{1}\begin{pmatrix}0.15475\\0.49734\\0.85364\end{pmatrix}\:$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{2}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}-2 - (3.1783) &4 &-3 \\-10 &6 - (3.1783) &-5 \\-8 &-9 &1 - (3.1783) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{2,1} \\v_{2,2} \\v_{2,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}-5.1783 &4 &-3 \\-10 &2.8217 &-5 \\-8 &-9 &-2.1783\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{2,1} \\v_{2,2} \\v_{2,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{2,1} = \frac{v_{2,1}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2 + v_{2,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{2,2} = \frac{v_{2,2}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2 + v_{2,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{2,3} = \frac{v_{2,3}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2 + v_{2,3}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{2}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{2} = k_{2}\begin{pmatrix}0.40923\\-0.14575\\-0.90071\end{pmatrix}\:$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{3}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}-2 - (7.5153) &4 &-3 \\-10 &6 - (7.5153) &-5 \\-8 &-9 &1 - (7.5153) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{3,1} \\v_{3,2} \\v_{3,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}-9.5153 &4 &-3 \\-10 &-1.5153 &-5 \\-8 &-9 &-6.5153\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{3,1} \\v_{3,2} \\v_{3,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{3,1} = \frac{v_{3,1}}{\sqrt{v_{3,1}^{2} + v_{3,2}^2 + v_{3,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{3,2} = \frac{v_{3,2}}{\sqrt{v_{3,1}^{2} + v_{3,2}^2 + v_{3,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{3,3} = \frac{v_{3,3}}{\sqrt{v_{3,1}^{2} + v_{3,2}^2 + v_{3,3}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{3}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{3} = k_{3}\begin{pmatrix}0.39442\\0.28244\\-0.87445\end{pmatrix}\:$$

generalfeedback.text:
In order to find the eigenvalues we look at characteristic equation $$\small det(A - \lambda I_{3}) = 0$$ where $$\small I_{3}$$ is a 3x3 identity matrix]

$$\small det(A - \lambda I_{3}) = \begin{vmatrix}7-\lambda &-10 &-2 \\-8 &7-\lambda &-1 \\-2 &-10 &4-\lambda\end{vmatrix}\: = 0 $$

Solving the determinant we get ,

$$\small \lambda_{1} =-4.0294$$  $$\small \lambda_{2} =6.3717$$  $$\small \lambda_{3} =15.6578$$

The associated eigenvectors can be calculated as follows:

$$\small (A - \lambda_{1} I_{3})V_{1} = 0$$  ,  $$\small (A - \lambda_{2} I_{3})V_{2} = 0$$  and  $$\small (A - \lambda_{3} I_{3})V_{3} = 0$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{1}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}7 - (-4.0294) &-10 &-2 \\-8 &7 - (-4.0294) &-1 \\-2 &-10 &4 - (-4.0294) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{1,1} \\v_{1,2} \\v_{1,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}11.0294 &-10 &-2 \\-8 &11.0294 &-1 \\-2 &-10 &8.0294\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{1,1} \\v_{1,2} \\v_{1,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{1,1} = \frac{v_{1,1}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{1,2} = \frac{v_{1,2}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{1,3} = \frac{v_{1,3}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{1}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{1} = k_{1}\begin{pmatrix}0.63468\\-0.63699\\0.43753\end{pmatrix}\:$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{2}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}7 - (6.3717) &-10 &-2 \\-8 &7 - (6.3717) &-1 \\-2 &-10 &4 - (6.3717) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{2,1} \\v_{2,2} \\v_{2,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}0.62834 &-10 &-2 \\-8 &0.62834 &-1 \\-2 &-10 &-2.3717\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{2,1} \\v_{2,2} \\v_{2,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{2,1} = \frac{v_{2,1}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2 + v_{2,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{2,2} = \frac{v_{2,2}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2 + v_{2,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{2,3} = \frac{v_{2,3}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2 + v_{2,3}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{2}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{2} = k_{2}\begin{pmatrix}0.13711\\0.20254\\-0.96963\end{pmatrix}\:$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{3}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}7 - (15.6578) &-10 &-2 \\-8 &7 - (15.6578) &-1 \\-2 &-10 &4 - (15.6578) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{3,1} \\v_{3,2} \\v_{3,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}-8.6578 &-10 &-2 \\-8 &-8.6578 &-1 \\-2 &-10 &-11.6578\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{3,1} \\v_{3,2} \\v_{3,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{3,1} = \frac{v_{3,1}}{\sqrt{v_{3,1}^{2} + v_{3,2}^2 + v_{3,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{3,2} = \frac{v_{3,2}}{\sqrt{v_{3,1}^{2} + v_{3,2}^2 + v_{3,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{3,3} = \frac{v_{3,3}}{\sqrt{v_{3,1}^{2} + v_{3,2}^2 + v_{3,3}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{3}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{3} = k_{3}\begin{pmatrix}0.63468\\-0.63699\\0.43753\end{pmatrix}\:$$

generalfeedback.text:
In order to find the eigenvalues we look at characteristic equation $$\small det(A - \lambda I_{3}) = 0$$ where $$\small I_{3}$$ is a 3x3 identity matrix]

$$\small det(A - \lambda I_{3}) = \begin{vmatrix}-3-\lambda &-5 &-4 \\-6 &-1-\lambda &-1 \\-4 &10 &4-\lambda\end{vmatrix}\: = 0 $$

Solving the determinant we get ,

$$\small \lambda_{1} =-5.6173$$  $$\small \lambda_{2} =-2.2247$$  $$\small \lambda_{3} =7.842$$

The associated eigenvectors can be calculated as follows:

$$\small (A - \lambda_{1} I_{3})V_{1} = 0$$  ,  $$\small (A - \lambda_{2} I_{3})V_{2} = 0$$  and  $$\small (A - \lambda_{3} I_{3})V_{3} = 0$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{1}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}-3 - (-5.6173) &-5 &-4 \\-6 &-1 - (-5.6173) &-1 \\-4 &10 &4 - (-5.6173) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{1,1} \\v_{1,2} \\v_{1,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}2.6173 &-5 &-4 \\-6 &4.6173 &-1 \\-4 &10 &9.6173\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{1,1} \\v_{1,2} \\v_{1,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{1,1} = \frac{v_{1,1}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{1,2} = \frac{v_{1,2}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{1,3} = \frac{v_{1,3}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{1}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{1} = k_{1}\begin{pmatrix}0.41198\\-0.1785\\-0.89354\end{pmatrix}\:$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{2}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}-3 - (-2.2247) &-5 &-4 \\-6 &-1 - (-2.2247) &-1 \\-4 &10 &4 - (-2.2247) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{2,1} \\v_{2,2} \\v_{2,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}-0.77529 &-5 &-4 \\-6 &1.2247 &-1 \\-4 &10 &6.2247\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{2,1} \\v_{2,2} \\v_{2,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{2,1} = \frac{v_{2,1}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2 + v_{2,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{2,2} = \frac{v_{2,2}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2 + v_{2,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{2,3} = \frac{v_{2,3}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2 + v_{2,3}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{2}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{2} = k_{2}\begin{pmatrix}0.24784\\0.58148\\-0.77489\end{pmatrix}\:$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{3}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}-3 - (7.842) &-5 &-4 \\-6 &-1 - (7.842) &-1 \\-4 &10 &4 - (7.842) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{3,1} \\v_{3,2} \\v_{3,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}-10.842 &-5 &-4 \\-6 &-8.842 &-1 \\-4 &10 &-3.842\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{3,1} \\v_{3,2} \\v_{3,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{3,1} = \frac{v_{3,1}}{\sqrt{v_{3,1}^{2} + v_{3,2}^2 + v_{3,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{3,2} = \frac{v_{3,2}}{\sqrt{v_{3,1}^{2} + v_{3,2}^2 + v_{3,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{3,3} = \frac{v_{3,3}}{\sqrt{v_{3,1}^{2} + v_{3,2}^2 + v_{3,3}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{3}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{3} = k_{3}\begin{pmatrix}0.41198\\-0.1785\\-0.89354\end{pmatrix}\:$$

generalfeedback.text:
In order to find the eigenvalues we look at characteristic equation $$\small det(A - \lambda I_{3}) = 0$$ where $$\small I_{3}$$ is a 3x3 identity matrix]

$$\small det(A - \lambda I_{3}) = \begin{vmatrix}2-\lambda &-7 &-3 \\-2 &1-\lambda &7 \\-4 &8 &5-\lambda\end{vmatrix}\: = 0 $$

Solving the determinant we get ,

$$\small \lambda_{1} =-4.1593$$  $$\small \lambda_{2} =-1.0889$$  $$\small \lambda_{3} =13.2482$$

The associated eigenvectors can be calculated as follows:

$$\small (A - \lambda_{1} I_{3})V_{1} = 0$$  ,  $$\small (A - \lambda_{2} I_{3})V_{2} = 0$$  and  $$\small (A - \lambda_{3} I_{3})V_{3} = 0$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{1}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}2 - (-4.1593) &-7 &-3 \\-2 &1 - (-4.1593) &7 \\-4 &8 &5 - (-4.1593) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{1,1} \\v_{1,2} \\v_{1,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}6.1593 &-7 &-3 \\-2 &5.1593 &7 \\-4 &8 &9.1593\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{1,1} \\v_{1,2} \\v_{1,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{1,1} = \frac{v_{1,1}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{1,2} = \frac{v_{1,2}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{1,3} = \frac{v_{1,3}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{1}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{1} = k_{1}\begin{pmatrix}0.63156\\0.69925\\-0.33494\end{pmatrix}\:$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{2,1} = \frac{v_{2,1}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2 + v_{2,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{2,2} = \frac{v_{2,2}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2 + v_{2,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{2,3} = \frac{v_{2,3}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2 + v_{2,3}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{2}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{2} = k_{2}\begin{pmatrix}0.92655\\0.33872\\0.16365\end{pmatrix}\:$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{3}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}2 - (13.2482) &-7 &-3 \\-2 &1 - (13.2482) &7 \\-4 &8 &5 - (13.2482) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{3,1} \\v_{3,2} \\v_{3,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}-11.2482 &-7 &-3 \\-2 &-12.2482 &7 \\-4 &8 &-8.2482\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{3,1} \\v_{3,2} \\v_{3,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

In order to find the eigenvalues we look at characteristic equation $$\small det(A - \lambda I_{3}) = 0$$ where $$\small I_{3}$$ is a 3x3 identity matrix]

$$\small det(A - \lambda I_{3}) = \begin{vmatrix}-8-\lambda &5 &-7 \\9 &-8-\lambda &10 \\-8 &10 &-4-\lambda\end{vmatrix}\: = 0 $$

Solving the determinant we get ,

$$\small \lambda_{1} =-22.9152$$  $$\small \lambda_{2} =-1.4271$$  $$\small \lambda_{3} =4.3423$$

The associated eigenvectors can be calculated as follows:

$$\small (A - \lambda_{1} I_{3})V_{1} = 0$$  ,  $$\small (A - \lambda_{2} I_{3})V_{2} = 0$$  and  $$\small (A - \lambda_{3} I_{3})V_{3} = 0$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{1}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}-8 - (-22.9152) &5 &-7 \\9 &-8 - (-22.9152) &10 \\-8 &10 &-4 - (-22.9152) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{1,1} \\v_{1,2} \\v_{1,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small v_{1,2} = \frac{v_{1,2}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{1,3} = \frac{v_{1,3}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

generalfeedback.text:
In order to find the eigenvalues we look at characteristic equation $$\small det(A - \lambda I_{3}) = 0$$ where $$\small I_{3}$$ is a 3x3 identity matrix]

$$\small det(A - \lambda I_{3}) = \begin{vmatrix}-8-\lambda &-9 &4 \\5 &7-\lambda &-2 \\4 &-10 &2-\lambda\end{vmatrix}\: = 0 $$

Solving the determinant we get ,

$$\small \lambda_{1} =-7.4353$$  $$\small \lambda_{2} =2.2002$$  $$\small \lambda_{3} =6.2351$$

The associated eigenvectors can be calculated as follows:

$$\small (A - \lambda_{1} I_{3})V_{1} = 0$$  ,  $$\small (A - \lambda_{2} I_{3})V_{2} = 0$$  and  $$\small (A - \lambda_{3} I_{3})V_{3} = 0$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{1}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}-8 - (-7.4353) &-9 &4 \\5 &7 - (-7.4353) &-2 \\4 &-10 &2 - (-7.4353) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{1,1} \\v_{1,2} \\v_{1,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}-0.56474 &-9 &4 \\5 &14.4353 &-2 \\4 &-10 &9.4353\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{1,1} \\v_{1,2} \\v_{1,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{1,1} = \frac{v_{1,1}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{1,2} = \frac{v_{1,2}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{1,3} = \frac{v_{1,3}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{1}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{1} = k_{1}\begin{pmatrix}0.69252\\-0.32883\\-0.6421\end{pmatrix}\:$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{2}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}-8 - (2.2002) &-9 &4 \\5 &7 - (2.2002) &-2 \\4 &-10 &2 - (2.2002) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{2,1} \\v_{2,2} \\v_{2,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}-10.2002 &-9 &4 \\5 &4.7998 &-2 \\4 &-10 &-0.20021\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{2,1} \\v_{2,2} \\v_{2,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{2,1} = \frac{v_{2,1}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2 + v_{2,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{2,2} = \frac{v_{2,2}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2 + v_{2,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{2,3} = \frac{v_{2,3}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2 + v_{2,3}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{2}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{2} = k_{2}\begin{pmatrix}0.28855\\0.096349\\0.9526\end{pmatrix}\:$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{3}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}-8 - (6.2351) &-9 &4 \\5 &7 - (6.2351) &-2 \\4 &-10 &2 - (6.2351) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{3,1} \\v_{3,2} \\v_{3,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}-14.2351 &-9 &4 \\5 &0.76494 &-2 \\4 &-10 &-4.2351\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{3,1} \\v_{3,2} \\v_{3,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{3,1} = \frac{v_{3,1}}{\sqrt{v_{3,1}^{2} + v_{3,2}^2 + v_{3,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{3,2} = \frac{v_{3,2}}{\sqrt{v_{3,1}^{2} + v_{3,2}^2 + v_{3,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{3,3} = \frac{v_{3,3}}{\sqrt{v_{3,1}^{2} + v_{3,2}^2 + v_{3,3}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{3}$$  can be written as:

Solving the determinant we get ,

$$\small \lambda_{1} =-9.8277$$  $$\small \lambda_{2} =-2.3557$$  $$\small \lambda_{3} =5.1834$$

The associated eigenvectors can be calculated as follows:

$$\small (A - \lambda_{1} I_{3})V_{1} = 0$$  ,  $$\small (A - \lambda_{2} I_{3})V_{2} = 0$$  and  $$\small (A - \lambda_{3} I_{3})V_{3} = 0$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{1}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}5 - (-9.8277) &-3 &-4 \\4 &-4 - (-9.8277) &-2 \\-8 &4 &-8 - (-9.8277) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{1,1} \\v_{1,2} \\v_{1,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}14.8277 &-3 &-4 \\4 &5.8277 &-2 \\-8 &4 &1.8277\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{1,1} \\v_{1,2} \\v_{1,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{1,1} = \frac{v_{1,1}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{1,2} = \frac{v_{1,2}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{1,3} = \frac{v_{1,3}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{1}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{1} = k_{1}\begin{pmatrix}0.82148\\0.43747\\-0.36576\end{pmatrix}\:$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{2}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}5 - (-2.3557) &-3 &-4 \\4 &-4 - (-2.3557) &-2 \\-8 &4 &-8 - (-2.3557) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{2,1} \\v_{2,2} \\v_{2,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}7.3557 &-3 &-4 \\4 &-1.6443 &-2 \\-8 &4 &-5.6443\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{2,1} \\v_{2,2} \\v_{2,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{2,1} = \frac{v_{2,1}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2 + v_{2,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{2,2} = \frac{v_{2,2}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2 + v_{2,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{2,3} = \frac{v_{2,3}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2 + v_{2,3}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{2}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{2} = k_{2}\begin{pmatrix}0.40789\\0.91056\\0.067164\end{pmatrix}\:$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{3}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}5 - (5.1834) &-3 &-4 \\4 &-4 - (5.1834) &-2 \\-8 &4 &-8 - (5.1834) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{3,1} \\v_{3,2} \\v_{3,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}-0.18337 &-3 &-4 \\4 &-9.1834 &-2 \\-8 &4 &-13.1834\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{3,1} \\v_{3,2} \\v_{3,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{3,1} = \frac{v_{3,1}}{\sqrt{v_{3,1}^{2} + v_{3,2}^2 + v_{3,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{3,2} = \frac{v_{3,2}}{\sqrt{v_{3,1}^{2} + v_{3,2}^2 + v_{3,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{3,3} = \frac{v_{3,3}}{\sqrt{v_{3,1}^{2} + v_{3,2}^2 + v_{3,3}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{3}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{3} = k_{3}\begin{pmatrix}0.82148\\0.43747\\-0.36576\end{pmatrix}\:$$

generalfeedback.text:
In order to find the eigenvalues we look at characteristic equation $$\small det(A - \lambda I_{3}) = 0$$ where $$\small I_{3}$$ is a 3x3 identity matrix]

$$\small det(A - \lambda I_{3}) = \begin{vmatrix}7-\lambda &-6 &-7 \\-4 &2-\lambda &3 \\-9 &-8 &-9-\lambda\end{vmatrix}\: = 0 $$

Solving the determinant we get ,

$$\small \lambda_{1} =-11.1223$$  $$\small \lambda_{2} =-0.53967$$  $$\small \lambda_{3} =11.662$$

The associated eigenvectors can be calculated as follows:

$$\small (A - \lambda_{1} I_{3})V_{1} = 0$$  ,  $$\small (A - \lambda_{2} I_{3})V_{2} = 0$$  and  $$\small (A - \lambda_{3} I_{3})V_{3} = 0$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{1}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}7 - (-11.1223) &-6 &-7 \\-4 &2 - (-11.1223) &3 \\-9 &-8 &-9 - (-11.1223) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{1,1} \\v_{1,2} \\v_{1,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}18.1223 &-6 &-7 \\-4 &13.1223 &3 \\-9 &-8 &2.1223\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{1,1} \\v_{1,2} \\v_{1,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small v_{1,1} = \frac{v_{1,1}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{1,2} = \frac{v_{1,2}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{1,3} = \frac{v_{1,3}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{1}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{1} = k_{1}\begin{pmatrix}0.87679\\-0.42989\\-0.21547\end{pmatrix}\:$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{2}$$ we get,

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{2}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{2} = k_{2}\begin{pmatrix}0.030668\\-0.74234\\0.66932\end{pmatrix}\:$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{3}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}7 - (11.662) &-6 &-7 \\-4 &2 - (11.662) &3 \\-9 &-8 &-9 - (11.662) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{3,1} \\v_{3,2} \\v_{3,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{3}$$  can be written as:

generalfeedback.text:
In order to find the eigenvalues we look at characteristic equation $$\small det(A - \lambda I_{3}) = 0$$ where $$\small I_{3}$$ is a 3x3 identity matrix]

$$\small det(A - \lambda I_{3}) = \begin{vmatrix}-4-\lambda &8 &-6 \\6 &10-\lambda &8 \\-9 &6 &7-\lambda\end{vmatrix}\: = 0 $$

Solving the determinant we get ,

$$\small \lambda_{1} =-11.8848$$  $$\small \lambda_{2} =9.785$$  $$\small \lambda_{3} =15.0999$$

The associated eigenvectors can be calculated as follows:

$$\small (A - \lambda_{1} I_{3})V_{1} = 0$$  ,  $$\small (A - \lambda_{2} I_{3})V_{2} = 0$$  and  $$\small (A - \lambda_{3} I_{3})V_{3} = 0$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{1}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}-4 - (-11.8848) &8 &-6 \\6 &10 - (-11.8848) &8 \\-9 &6 &7 - (-11.8848) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{1,1} \\v_{1,2} \\v_{1,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}7.8848 &8 &-6 \\6 &21.8848 &8 \\-9 &6 &18.8848\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{1,1} \\v_{1,2} \\v_{1,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{1,1} = \frac{v_{1,1}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{1,2} = \frac{v_{1,2}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{1,3} = \frac{v_{1,3}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{1}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{1} = k_{1}\begin{pmatrix}0.7752\\-0.39325\\0.49438\end{pmatrix}\:$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{2}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}-4 - (9.785) &8 &-6 \\6 &10 - (9.785) &8 \\-9 &6 &7 - (9.785) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{2,1} \\v_{2,2} \\v_{2,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}-13.785 &8 &-6 \\6 &0.21504 &8 \\-9 &6 &-2.785\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{2,1} \\v_{2,2} \\v_{2,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{2,1} = \frac{v_{2,1}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2 + v_{2,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{2,2} = \frac{v_{2,2}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2 + v_{2,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{2,3} = \frac{v_{2,3}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2 + v_{2,3}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{2}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{2} = k_{2}\begin{pmatrix}0.58685\\0.66765\\-0.45809\end{pmatrix}\:$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{3}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}-4 - (15.0999) &8 &-6 \\6 &10 - (15.0999) &8 \\-9 &6 &7 - (15.0999) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{3,1} \\v_{3,2} \\v_{3,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}-19.0999 &8 &-6 \\6 &-5.0999 &8 \\-9 &6 &-8.0999\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{3,1} \\v_{3,2} \\v_{3,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{3,2} = \frac{v_{3,2}}{\sqrt{v_{3,1}^{2} + v_{3,2}^2 + v_{3,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{3,3} = \frac{v_{3,3}}{\sqrt{v_{3,1}^{2} + v_{3,2}^2 + v_{3,3}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{3}$$  can be written as:

$$\small det(A - \lambda I_{3}) = \begin{vmatrix}-7-\lambda &-5 &5 \\-10 &-3-\lambda &4 \\-2 &5 &8-\lambda\end{vmatrix}\: = 0 $$

Solving the determinant we get ,

$$\small \lambda_{1} =-13.0591$$  $$\small \lambda_{2} =3.2595$$  $$\small \lambda_{3} =7.7997$$

The associated eigenvectors can be calculated as follows:

$$\small (A - \lambda_{1} I_{3})V_{1} = 0$$  ,  $$\small (A - \lambda_{2} I_{3})V_{2} = 0$$  and  $$\small (A - \lambda_{3} I_{3})V_{3} = 0$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{1}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}-7 - (-13.0591) &-5 &5 \\-10 &-3 - (-13.0591) &4 \\-2 &5 &8 - (-13.0591) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{1,1} \\v_{1,2} \\v_{1,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}6.0591 &-5 &5 \\-10 &10.0591 &4 \\-2 &5 &21.0591\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{1,1} \\v_{1,2} \\v_{1,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{1,1} = \frac{v_{1,1}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{1,2} = \frac{v_{1,2}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{1,3} = \frac{v_{1,3}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{1}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{1} = k_{1}\begin{pmatrix}0.68366\\0.72199\\-0.10649\end{pmatrix}\:$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{2}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}-7 - (3.2595) &-5 &5 \\-10 &-3 - (3.2595) &4 \\-2 &5 &8 - (3.2595) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{2,1} \\v_{2,2} \\v_{2,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}-10.2595 &-5 &5 \\-10 &-6.2595 &4 \\-2 &5 &4.7405\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{2,1} \\v_{2,2} \\v_{2,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{2,1} = \frac{v_{2,1}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2 + v_{2,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{2,2} = \frac{v_{2,2}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2 + v_{2,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{2,3} = \frac{v_{2,3}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2 + v_{2,3}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{2}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{2} = k_{2}\begin{pmatrix}0.55785\\-0.44254\\0.70211\end{pmatrix}\:$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{3}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}-7 - (7.7997) &-5 &5 \\-10 &-3 - (7.7997) &4 \\-2 &5 &8 - (7.7997) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{3,1} \\v_{3,2} \\v_{3,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}-14.7997 &-5 &5 \\-10 &-10.7997 &4 \\-2 &5 &0.20034\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{3,1} \\v_{3,2} \\v_{3,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{3,1} = \frac{v_{3,1}}{\sqrt{v_{3,1}^{2} + v_{3,2}^2 + v_{3,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{3,2} = \frac{v_{3,2}}{\sqrt{v_{3,1}^{2} + v_{3,2}^2 + v_{3,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{3,3} = \frac{v_{3,3}}{\sqrt{v_{3,1}^{2} + v_{3,2}^2 + v_{3,3}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{3}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{3} = k_{3}\begin{pmatrix}0.29476\\0.079752\\0.95224\end{pmatrix}\:$$

The associated eigenvectors can be calculated as follows:

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}8 - (8.3906) &-4 &3 \\-7 &-8 - (8.3906) &-3 \\-3 &-4 &4 - (8.3906) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{3,1} \\v_{3,2} \\v_{3,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}-0.39058 &-4 &3 \\-7 &-16.3906 &-3 \\-3 &-4 &-4.3906\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{3,1} \\v_{3,2} \\v_{3,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{3,1} = \frac{v_{3,1}}{\sqrt{v_{3,1}^{2} + v_{3,2}^2 + v_{3,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{3,2} = \frac{v_{3,2}}{\sqrt{v_{3,1}^{2} + v_{3,2}^2 + v_{3,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{3,3} = \frac{v_{3,3}}{\sqrt{v_{3,1}^{2} + v_{3,2}^2 + v_{3,3}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{3}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{3} = k_{3}\begin{pmatrix}0.89228\\-0.32341\\-0.31504\end{pmatrix}\:$$

generalfeedback.text:
In order to find the eigenvalues we look at characteristic equation $$\small det(A - \lambda I_{3}) = 0$$ where $$\small I_{3}$$ is a 3x3 identity matrix]

$$\small det(A - \lambda I_{3}) = \begin{vmatrix}-9-\lambda &8 &-3 \\7 &7-\lambda &-5 \\-1 &9 &-7-\lambda\end{vmatrix}\: = 0 $$

Solving the determinant we get ,

$$\small \lambda_{1} =-12.4024$$  $$\small \lambda_{2} =-3.1667$$  $$\small \lambda_{3} =6.5691$$

The associated eigenvectors can be calculated as follows:

$$\small (A - \lambda_{1} I_{3})V_{1} = 0$$  ,  $$\small (A - \lambda_{2} I_{3})V_{2} = 0$$  and  $$\small (A - \lambda_{3} I_{3})V_{3} = 0$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{1}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}-9 - (-12.4024) &8 &-3 \\7 &7 - (-12.4024) &-5 \\-1 &9 &-7 - (-12.4024) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{1,1} \\v_{1,2} \\v_{1,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}3.4024 &8 &-3 \\7 &19.4024 &-5 \\-1 &9 &5.4024\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{1,1} \\v_{1,2} \\v_{1,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{1,1} = \frac{v_{1,1}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{1,2} = \frac{v_{1,2}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{1,3} = \frac{v_{1,3}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{1}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{1} = k_{1}\begin{pmatrix}0.86051\\-0.18849\\0.47329\end{pmatrix}\:$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{2}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}-9 - (-3.1667) &8 &-3 \\7 &7 - (-3.1667) &-5 \\-1 &9 &-7 - (-3.1667) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{2,1} \\v_{2,2} \\v_{2,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}-5.8333 &8 &-3 \\7 &10.1667 &-5 \\-1 &9 &-3.8333\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{2,1} \\v_{2,2} \\v_{2,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{2,1} = \frac{v_{2,1}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2 + v_{2,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{2,2} = \frac{v_{2,2}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2 + v_{2,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{2,3} = \frac{v_{2,3}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2 + v_{2,3}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{2}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{2} = k_{2}\begin{pmatrix}0.075333\\0.39782\\0.91437\end{pmatrix}\:$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{3}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}-9 - (6.5691) &8 &-3 \\7 &7 - (6.5691) &-5 \\-1 &9 &-7 - (6.5691) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{3,1} \\v_{3,2} \\v_{3,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}-15.5691 &8 &-3 \\7 &0.43091 &-5 \\-1 &9 &-13.5691\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{3,1} \\v_{3,2} \\v_{3,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{3,1} = \frac{v_{3,1}}{\sqrt{v_{3,1}^{2} + v_{3,2}^2 + v_{3,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{3,2} = \frac{v_{3,2}}{\sqrt{v_{3,1}^{2} + v_{3,2}^2 + v_{3,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{3,3} = \frac{v_{3,3}}{\sqrt{v_{3,1}^{2} + v_{3,2}^2 + v_{3,3}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{3}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{3} = k_{3}\begin{pmatrix}0.31395\\0.80171\\0.50862\end{pmatrix}\:$$

generalfeedback.text:
In order to find the eigenvalues we look at characteristic equation $$\small det(A - \lambda I_{3}) = 0$$ where $$\small I_{3}$$ is a 3x3 identity matrix]

$$\small det(A - \lambda I_{3}) = \begin{vmatrix}10-\lambda &-1 &-8 \\9 &-2-\lambda &-6 \\-9 &-9 &4-\lambda\end{vmatrix}\: = 0 $$

Solving the determinant we get ,

$$\small \lambda_{1} =-4.225$$  $$\small \lambda_{2} =-2$$  $$\small \lambda_{3} =18.225$$

The associated eigenvectors can be calculated as follows:

$$\small (A - \lambda_{1} I_{3})V_{1} = 0$$  ,  $$\small (A - \lambda_{2} I_{3})V_{2} = 0$$  and  $$\small (A - \lambda_{3} I_{3})V_{3} = 0$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{1}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}10 - (-4.225) &-1 &-8 \\9 &-2 - (-4.225) &-6 \\-9 &-9 &4 - (-4.225) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{1,1} \\v_{1,2} \\v_{1,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}14.225 &-1 &-8 \\9 &2.225 &-6 \\-9 &-9 &8.225\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{1,1} \\v_{1,2} \\v_{1,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{1,1} = \frac{v_{1,1}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{1,2} = \frac{v_{1,2}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{1,3} = \frac{v_{1,3}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{1}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{1} = k_{1}\begin{pmatrix}0.48611\\0.27267\\0.83027\end{pmatrix}\:$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{2}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}10 - (-2) &-1 &-8 \\9 &-2 - (-2) &-6 \\-9 &-9 &4 - (-2) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{2,1} \\v_{2,2} \\v_{2,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}12 &-1 &-8 \\9 &-8.8818e-16 &-6 \\-9 &-9 &6\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{2,1} \\v_{2,2} \\v_{2,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{2,1} = \frac{v_{2,1}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2 + v_{2,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{2,2} = \frac{v_{2,2}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2 + v_{2,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{2,3} = \frac{v_{2,3}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2 + v_{2,3}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{2}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{2} = k_{2}\begin{pmatrix}0.5547\\-1.7578e-16\\0.83205\end{pmatrix}\:$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{3}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}10 - (18.225) &-1 &-8 \\9 &-2 - (18.225) &-6 \\-9 &-9 &4 - (18.225) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{3,1} \\v_{3,2} \\v_{3,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}-8.225 &-1 &-8 \\9 &-20.225 &-6 \\-9 &-9 &-14.225\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{3,1} \\v_{3,2} \\v_{3,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{3,1} = \frac{v_{3,1}}{\sqrt{v_{3,1}^{2} + v_{3,2}^2 + v_{3,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{3,2} = \frac{v_{3,2}}{\sqrt{v_{3,1}^{2} + v_{3,2}^2 + v_{3,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{3,3} = \frac{v_{3,3}}{\sqrt{v_{3,1}^{2} + v_{3,2}^2 + v_{3,3}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{3}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{3} = k_{3}\begin{pmatrix}0.58994\\0.45949\\-0.66396\end{pmatrix}\:$$

generalfeedback.text:
In order to find the eigenvalues we look at characteristic equation $$\small det(A - \lambda I_{3}) = 0$$ where $$\small I_{3}$$ is a 3x3 identity matrix]

$$\small det(A - \lambda I_{3}) = \begin{vmatrix}7-\lambda &-6 &-2 \\-8 &5-\lambda &-8 \\10 &-8 &-7-\lambda\end{vmatrix}\: = 0 $$

Solving the determinant we get ,

$$\small \lambda_{1} =-9.2015$$  $$\small \lambda_{2} =-0.69316$$  $$\small \lambda_{3} =14.8947$$

The associated eigenvectors can be calculated as follows:

$$\small (A - \lambda_{1} I_{3})V_{1} = 0$$  ,  $$\small (A - \lambda_{2} I_{3})V_{2} = 0$$  and  $$\small (A - \lambda_{3} I_{3})V_{3} = 0$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{1}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}7 - (-9.2015) &-6 &-2 \\-8 &5 - (-9.2015) &-8 \\10 &-8 &-7 - (-9.2015) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{1,1} \\v_{1,2} \\v_{1,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}16.2015 &-6 &-2 \\-8 &14.2015 &-8 \\10 &-8 &2.2015\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{1,1} \\v_{1,2} \\v_{1,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{1,1} = \frac{v_{1,1}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{1,2} = \frac{v_{1,2}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{1,3} = \frac{v_{1,3}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{1}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{1} = k_{1}\begin{pmatrix}0.31141\\0.59349\\0.74215\end{pmatrix}\:$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{2}$$ we get,

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{2,1} = \frac{v_{2,1}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2 + v_{2,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{2,2} = \frac{v_{2,2}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2 + v_{2,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{2,3} = \frac{v_{2,3}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2 + v_{2,3}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{2}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{2} = k_{2}\begin{pmatrix}0.60745\\0.79319\\-0.042978\end{pmatrix}\:$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{3}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}7 - (14.8947) &-6 &-2 \\-8 &5 - (14.8947) &-8 \\10 &-8 &-7 - (14.8947) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{3,1} \\v_{3,2} \\v_{3,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}-7.8947 &-6 &-2 \\-8 &-9.8947 &-8 \\10 &-8 &-21.8947\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{3,1} \\v_{3,2} \\v_{3,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

questiontext.text:
Find the eigenvalues and the associated eigenvectors of the following matrix:

$$\small A = \begin{pmatrix}5 &3 &-2 \\8 &-8 &10 \\-9 &10 &-9\end{pmatrix}\:$$

Calculate upto 3 significant figures and answer in increasing order $$\small\lambda_{1}\leq\lambda_{2}\leq\lambda_{3}$$

EigenValues:

$$\small \lambda_{1} = $${1:NUMERICAL:=-20.1916:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}  $$\small \lambda_{2} = $${1:NUMERICAL:=1.5709:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}  $$\small \lambda_{3} = $${1:NUMERICAL:=6.6207:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}

Associated EigenVectors:

$$\small V_{1} = k_{1}\begin{pmatrix}v_{1,1}\\v_{1,2}\\v_{1,3}\end{pmatrix}\:$$   $$\small V_{2} = k_2\begin{pmatrix}v_{2,1}\\v_{2,2}\\v_{2,3}\end{pmatrix}\:$$   $$\small V_{3} = k_3\begin{pmatrix}v_{3,1}\\v_{3,2}\\v_{3,3}\end{pmatrix}\:$$

Specify the answer as a unitory vector where $$\small v_{1,1}$$ , $$\small v_{2,1}$$ and $$\small v_{3,1}$$ are positive. In case $$\small v_{1,1}$$ , $$\small v_{2,1}$$ or $$\small v_{3,1}$$ are negative , you can multiply all the elements of the matrix by -1 to make them positive. If $$\small v_{1,1} = 0$$ , $$\small v_{2,1} = 0$$ or $$\small v_{3,1} = 0$$ then check and make sure that $$\small v_{1,2}$$ , $$\small v_{2,2}$$ or $$\small v_{3,2}$$ is given as positive respectively. If $$\small v_{1,1} = v_{1,2} = 0$$ , $$\small v_{2,1} = v_{2,2} = 0$$ or $$\small v_{3,1} = v_{3,2} = 0$$ then check and make sure that $$\small v_{1,3}$$ , $$\small v_{2,3}$$ or $$\small v_{3,3}$$ is given as positive respectively.

$$\small V_{1} = k_{1}$$  
{1:NUMERICAL:=0.13818:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}
{1:NUMERICAL:=-0.68074:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}
{1:NUMERICAL:=0.71938:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}
  
   
$$\small V_{2} = k_{2}$$  
{1:NUMERICAL:=0.14166:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}
{1:NUMERICAL:=-0.65609:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}
{1:NUMERICAL:=-0.74127:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}
  
   
$$\small V_{3} = k_{3}$$  
{1:NUMERICAL:=0.89962:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}
{1:NUMERICAL:=0.24501:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}
{1:NUMERICAL:=-0.36147:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}

generalfeedback.text:
In order to find the eigenvalues we look at characteristic equation $$\small det(A - \lambda I_{3}) = 0$$ where $$\small I_{3}$$ is a 3x3 identity matrix]

$$\small det(A - \lambda I_{3}) = \begin{vmatrix}5-\lambda &3 &-2 \\8 &-8-\lambda &10 \\-9 &10 &-9-\lambda\end{vmatrix}\: = 0 $$

Solving the determinant we get ,

$$\small \lambda_{1} =-20.1916$$  $$\small \lambda_{2} =1.5709$$  $$\small \lambda_{3} =6.6207$$

The associated eigenvectors can be calculated as follows:

$$\small (A - \lambda_{1} I_{3})V_{1} = 0$$  ,  $$\small (A - \lambda_{2} I_{3})V_{2} = 0$$  and  $$\small (A - \lambda_{3} I_{3})V_{3} = 0$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{1}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}5 - (-20.1916) &3 &-2 \\8 &-8 - (-20.1916) &10 \\-9 &10 &-9 - (-20.1916) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{1,1} \\v_{1,2} \\v_{1,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}25.1916 &3 &-2 \\8 &12.1916 &10 \\-9 &10 &11.1916\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{1,1} \\v_{1,2} \\v_{1,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{1,1} = \frac{v_{1,1}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{1,2} = \frac{v_{1,2}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{1,3} = \frac{v_{1,3}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{1}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{1} = k_{1}\begin{pmatrix}0.13818\\-0.68074\\0.71938\end{pmatrix}\:$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{2}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}5 - (1.5709) &3 &-2 \\8 &-8 - (1.5709) &10 \\-9 &10 &-9 - (1.5709) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{2,1} \\v_{2,2} \\v_{2,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}3.4291 &3 &-2 \\8 &-9.5709 &10 \\-9 &10 &-10.5709\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{2,1} \\v_{2,2} \\v_{2,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{2,1} = \frac{v_{2,1}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2 + v_{2,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{2,2} = \frac{v_{2,2}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2 + v_{2,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{2,3} = \frac{v_{2,3}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2 + v_{2,3}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{2}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{2} = k_{2}\begin{pmatrix}0.14166\\-0.65609\\-0.74127\end{pmatrix}\:$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{3}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}5 - (6.6207) &3 &-2 \\8 &-8 - (6.6207) &10 \\-9 &10 &-9 - (6.6207) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{3,1} \\v_{3,2} \\v_{3,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}-1.6207 &3 &-2 \\8 &-14.6207 &10 \\-9 &10 &-15.6207\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{3,1} \\v_{3,2} \\v_{3,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{3,1} = \frac{v_{3,1}}{\sqrt{v_{3,1}^{2} + v_{3,2}^2 + v_{3,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{3,2} = \frac{v_{3,2}}{\sqrt{v_{3,1}^{2} + v_{3,2}^2 + v_{3,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{3,3} = \frac{v_{3,3}}{\sqrt{v_{3,1}^{2} + v_{3,2}^2 + v_{3,3}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{3}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{3} = k_{3}\begin{pmatrix}0.89962\\0.24501\\-0.36147\end{pmatrix}\:$$

generalfeedback.text:
In order to find the eigenvalues we look at characteristic equation $$\small det(A - \lambda I_{3}) = 0$$ where $$\small I_{3}$$ is a 3x3 identity matrix]

$$\small det(A - \lambda I_{3}) = \begin{vmatrix}-3-\lambda &-8 &6 \\-7 &4-\lambda &8 \\1 &-5 &1-\lambda\end{vmatrix}\: = 0 $$

Solving the determinant we get ,

$$\small \lambda_{1} =-5.7446$$  $$\small \lambda_{2} =2$$  $$\small \lambda_{3} =5.7446$$

The associated eigenvectors can be calculated as follows:

$$\small (A - \lambda_{1} I_{3})V_{1} = 0$$  ,  $$\small (A - \lambda_{2} I_{3})V_{2} = 0$$  and  $$\small (A - \lambda_{3} I_{3})V_{3} = 0$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{1}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}-3 - (-5.7446) &-8 &6 \\-7 &4 - (-5.7446) &8 \\1 &-5 &1 - (-5.7446) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{1,1} \\v_{1,2} \\v_{1,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}2.7446 &-8 &6 \\-7 &9.7446 &8 \\1 &-5 &6.7446\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{1,1} \\v_{1,2} \\v_{1,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{1,1} = \frac{v_{1,1}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{1,2} = \frac{v_{1,2}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{1,3} = \frac{v_{1,3}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{1}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{1} = k_{1}\begin{pmatrix}0.86718\\0.45287\\0.20715\end{pmatrix}\:$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{2}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}-3 - (2) &-8 &6 \\-7 &4 - (2) &8 \\1 &-5 &1 - (2) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{2,1} \\v_{2,2} \\v_{2,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}-5 &-8 &6 \\-7 &2 &8 \\1 &-5 &-1\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{2,1} \\v_{2,2} \\v_{2,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{2,1} = \frac{v_{2,1}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2 + v_{2,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{2,2} = \frac{v_{2,2}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2 + v_{2,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{2,3} = \frac{v_{2,3}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2 + v_{2,3}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{2}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{2} = k_{2}\begin{pmatrix}0.75488\\0.019865\\0.65556\end{pmatrix}\:$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{3}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}-3 - (5.7446) &-8 &6 \\-7 &4 - (5.7446) &8 \\1 &-5 &1 - (5.7446) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{3,1} \\v_{3,2} \\v_{3,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}-8.7446 &-8 &6 \\-7 &-1.7446 &8 \\1 &-5 &-4.7446\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{3,1} \\v_{3,2} \\v_{3,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{3,1} = \frac{v_{3,1}}{\sqrt{v_{3,1}^{2} + v_{3,2}^2 + v_{3,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{3,2} = \frac{v_{3,2}}{\sqrt{v_{3,1}^{2} + v_{3,2}^2 + v_{3,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{3,3} = \frac{v_{3,3}}{\sqrt{v_{3,1}^{2} + v_{3,2}^2 + v_{3,3}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{3}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{3} = k_{3}\begin{pmatrix}0.73481\\-0.38374\\0.55928\end{pmatrix}\:$$

generalfeedback.text:
In order to find the eigenvalues we look at characteristic equation $$\small det(A - \lambda I_{3}) = 0$$ where $$\small I_{3}$$ is a 3x3 identity matrix]

$$\small det(A - \lambda I_{3}) = \begin{vmatrix}-3-\lambda &-3 &-3 \\9 &10-\lambda &-6 \\-3 &-4 &-8-\lambda\end{vmatrix}\: = 0 $$

Solving the determinant we get ,

$$\small \lambda_{1} =-9.7798$$  $$\small \lambda_{2} =-0.65057$$  $$\small \lambda_{3} =9.4304$$

The associated eigenvectors can be calculated as follows:

$$\small (A - \lambda_{1} I_{3})V_{1} = 0$$  ,  $$\small (A - \lambda_{2} I_{3})V_{2} = 0$$  and  $$\small (A - \lambda_{3} I_{3})V_{3} = 0$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{1}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}-3 - (-9.7798) &-3 &-3 \\9 &10 - (-9.7798) &-6 \\-3 &-4 &-8 - (-9.7798) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{1,1} \\v_{1,2} \\v_{1,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}6.7798 &-3 &-3 \\9 &19.7798 &-6 \\-3 &-4 &1.7798\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{1,1} \\v_{1,2} \\v_{1,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{1,1} = \frac{v_{1,1}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{1,2} = \frac{v_{1,2}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{1,3} = \frac{v_{1,3}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{1}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{1} = k_{1}\begin{pmatrix}0.43151\\0.076321\\0.89887\end{pmatrix}\:$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{2}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}-3 - (-0.65057) &-3 &-3 \\9 &10 - (-0.65057) &-6 \\-3 &-4 &-8 - (-0.65057) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{2,1} \\v_{2,2} \\v_{2,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}-2.3494 &-3 &-3 \\9 &10.6506 &-6 \\-3 &-4 &-7.3494\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{2,1} \\v_{2,2} \\v_{2,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{2,1} = \frac{v_{2,1}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2 + v_{2,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{2,2} = \frac{v_{2,2}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2 + v_{2,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{2,3} = \frac{v_{2,3}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2 + v_{2,3}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{2}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{2} = k_{2}\begin{pmatrix}0.77187\\-0.63504\\0.030553\end{pmatrix}\:$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{3}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}-3 - (9.4304) &-3 &-3 \\9 &10 - (9.4304) &-6 \\-3 &-4 &-8 - (9.4304) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{3,1} \\v_{3,2} \\v_{3,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}-12.4304 &-3 &-3 \\9 &0.56962 &-6 \\-3 &-4 &-17.4304\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{3,1} \\v_{3,2} \\v_{3,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{3,1} = \frac{v_{3,1}}{\sqrt{v_{3,1}^{2} + v_{3,2}^2 + v_{3,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{3,2} = \frac{v_{3,2}}{\sqrt{v_{3,1}^{2} + v_{3,2}^2 + v_{3,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{3,3} = \frac{v_{3,3}}{\sqrt{v_{3,1}^{2} + v_{3,2}^2 + v_{3,3}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{3}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{3} = k_{3}\begin{pmatrix}0.18703\\-0.96399\\0.18903\end{pmatrix}\:$$

In order to find the eigenvalues we look at characteristic equation $$\small det(A - \lambda I_{3}) = 0$$ where $$\small I_{3}$$ is a 3x3 identity matrix]

$$\small det(A - \lambda I_{3}) = \begin{vmatrix}-1-\lambda &-10 &-5 \\-6 &-3-\lambda &-3 \\-4 &-5 &-9-\lambda\end{vmatrix}\: = 0 $$

Solving the determinant we get ,

$$\small \lambda_{1} =-15.3016$$  $$\small \lambda_{2} =-3.551$$  $$\small \lambda_{3} =5.8525$$

The associated eigenvectors can be calculated as follows:

$$\small (A - \lambda_{1} I_{3})V_{1} = 0$$  ,  $$\small (A - \lambda_{2} I_{3})V_{2} = 0$$  and  $$\small (A - \lambda_{3} I_{3})V_{3} = 0$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{1}$$ we get,

$$\small v_{1,2} = \frac{v_{1,2}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

generalfeedback.text:
In order to find the eigenvalues we look at characteristic equation $$\small det(A - \lambda I_{3}) = 0$$ where $$\small I_{3}$$ is a 3x3 identity matrix]

$$\small det(A - \lambda I_{3}) = \begin{vmatrix}-1-\lambda &-10 &7 \\-3 &10-\lambda &-3 \\3 &-10 &8-\lambda\end{vmatrix}\: = 0 $$

Solving the determinant we get ,

$$\small \lambda_{1} =-3.61$$  $$\small \lambda_{2} =3.1782$$  $$\small \lambda_{3} =17.4318$$

The associated eigenvectors can be calculated as follows:

$$\small (A - \lambda_{1} I_{3})V_{1} = 0$$  ,  $$\small (A - \lambda_{2} I_{3})V_{2} = 0$$  and  $$\small (A - \lambda_{3} I_{3})V_{3} = 0$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{1}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}-1 - (-3.61) &-10 &7 \\-3 &10 - (-3.61) &-3 \\3 &-10 &8 - (-3.61) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{1,1} \\v_{1,2} \\v_{1,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}2.61 &-10 &7 \\-3 &13.61 &-3 \\3 &-10 &11.61\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{1,1} \\v_{1,2} \\v_{1,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{1,1} = \frac{v_{1,1}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{1,2} = \frac{v_{1,2}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{1,3} = \frac{v_{1,3}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{1}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{1} = k_{1}\begin{pmatrix}0.52952\\-0.49255\\0.69065\end{pmatrix}\:$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{2}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}-1 - (3.1782) &-10 &7 \\-3 &10 - (3.1782) &-3 \\3 &-10 &8 - (3.1782) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{2,1} \\v_{2,2} \\v_{2,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{2,1} = \frac{v_{2,1}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2 + v_{2,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{2,2} = \frac{v_{2,2}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2 + v_{2,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{2,3} = \frac{v_{2,3}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2 + v_{2,3}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{2}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{2} = k_{2}\begin{pmatrix}0.25459\\0.48092\\0.83899\end{pmatrix}\:$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{3}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}-1 - (17.4318) &-10 &7 \\-3 &10 - (17.4318) &-3 \\3 &-10 &8 - (17.4318) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{3,1} \\v_{3,2} \\v_{3,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}-18.4318 &-10 &7 \\-3 &-7.4318 &-3 \\3 &-10 &-9.4318\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{3,1} \\v_{3,2} \\v_{3,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{3,2} = \frac{v_{3,2}}{\sqrt{v_{3,1}^{2} + v_{3,2}^2 + v_{3,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{3,3} = \frac{v_{3,3}}{\sqrt{v_{3,1}^{2} + v_{3,2}^2 + v_{3,3}^2}} $$

$$\small det(A - \lambda I_{3}) = \begin{vmatrix}-6-\lambda &-4 &-6 \\-10 &-3-\lambda &10 \\-9 &-1 &5-\lambda\end{vmatrix}\: = 0 $$

Solving the determinant we get ,

$$\small \lambda_{1} =-11.4617$$  $$\small \lambda_{2} =-2.5457$$  $$\small \lambda_{3} =10.0074$$

The associated eigenvectors can be calculated as follows:

$$\small (A - \lambda_{1} I_{3})V_{1} = 0$$  ,  $$\small (A - \lambda_{2} I_{3})V_{2} = 0$$  and  $$\small (A - \lambda_{3} I_{3})V_{3} = 0$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{1}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}-6 - (-11.4617) &-4 &-6 \\-10 &-3 - (-11.4617) &10 \\-9 &-1 &5 - (-11.4617) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{1,1} \\v_{1,2} \\v_{1,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}5.4617 &-4 &-6 \\-10 &8.4617 &10 \\-9 &-1 &16.4617\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{1,1} \\v_{1,2} \\v_{1,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{1,1} = \frac{v_{1,1}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{1,2} = \frac{v_{1,2}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{1,3} = \frac{v_{1,3}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{1}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{1} = k_{1}\begin{pmatrix}0.39204\\-0.73089\\-0.55866\end{pmatrix}\:$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{2}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}-6 - (-2.5457) &-4 &-6 \\-10 &-3 - (-2.5457) &10 \\-9 &-1 &5 - (-2.5457) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{2,1} \\v_{2,2} \\v_{2,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}-3.4543 &-4 &-6 \\-10 &-0.45428 &10 \\-9 &-1 &7.5457\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{2,1} \\v_{2,2} \\v_{2,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{2,1} = \frac{v_{2,1}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2 + v_{2,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{2,2} = \frac{v_{2,2}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2 + v_{2,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{2,3} = \frac{v_{2,3}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2 + v_{2,3}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{2}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{2} = k_{2}\begin{pmatrix}0.38618\\-0.85452\\0.34736\end{pmatrix}\:$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{3}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}-6 - (10.0074) &-4 &-6 \\-10 &-3 - (10.0074) &10 \\-9 &-1 &5 - (10.0074) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{3,1} \\v_{3,2} \\v_{3,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}-16.0074 &-4 &-6 \\-10 &-13.0074 &10 \\-9 &-1 &-5.0074\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{3,1} \\v_{3,2} \\v_{3,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{3,1} = \frac{v_{3,1}}{\sqrt{v_{3,1}^{2} + v_{3,2}^2 + v_{3,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{3,2} = \frac{v_{3,2}}{\sqrt{v_{3,1}^{2} + v_{3,2}^2 + v_{3,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{3,3} = \frac{v_{3,3}}{\sqrt{v_{3,1}^{2} + v_{3,2}^2 + v_{3,3}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{3}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{3} = k_{3}\begin{pmatrix}0.39204\\-0.73089\\-0.55866\end{pmatrix}\:$$

$$\small det(A - \lambda I_{3}) = \begin{vmatrix}-9-\lambda &-6 &-6 \\-5 &-1-\lambda &-8 \\-4 &-1 &5-\lambda\end{vmatrix}\: = 0 $$

Solving the determinant we get ,

$$\small \lambda_{1} =-13.7284$$  $$\small \lambda_{2} =2.8743$$  $$\small \lambda_{3} =5.854$$

The associated eigenvectors can be calculated as follows:

$$\small (A - \lambda_{1} I_{3})V_{1} = 0$$  ,  $$\small (A - \lambda_{2} I_{3})V_{2} = 0$$  and  $$\small (A - \lambda_{3} I_{3})V_{3} = 0$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{1}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}-9 - (-13.7284) &-6 &-6 \\-5 &-1 - (-13.7284) &-8 \\-4 &-1 &5 - (-13.7284) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{1,1} \\v_{1,2} \\v_{1,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small v_{1,2} = \frac{v_{1,2}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{1,3} = \frac{v_{1,3}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

Calculate upto 3 significant figures and answer in increasing order $$\small\lambda_{1}\leq\lambda_{2}\leq\lambda_{3}$$

EigenValues:

$$\small \lambda_{1} = $${1:NUMERICAL:=-10.9255:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}  $$\small \lambda_{2} = $${1:NUMERICAL:=-0.83897:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}  $$\small \lambda_{3} = $${1:NUMERICAL:=12.7644:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}

Associated EigenVectors:

$$\small V_{1} = k_{1}\begin{pmatrix}v_{1,1}\\v_{1,2}\\v_{1,3}\end{pmatrix}\:$$   $$\small V_{2} = k_2\begin{pmatrix}v_{2,1}\\v_{2,2}\\v_{2,3}\end{pmatrix}\:$$   $$\small V_{3} = k_3\begin{pmatrix}v_{3,1}\\v_{3,2}\\v_{3,3}\end{pmatrix}\:$$

Specify the answer as a unitory vector where $$\small v_{1,1}$$ , $$\small v_{2,1}$$ and $$\small v_{3,1}$$ are positive. In case $$\small v_{1,1}$$ , $$\small v_{2,1}$$ or $$\small v_{3,1}$$ are negative , you can multiply all the elements of the matrix by -1 to make them positive. If $$\small v_{1,1} = 0$$ , $$\small v_{2,1} = 0$$ or $$\small v_{3,1} = 0$$ then check and make sure that $$\small v_{1,2}$$ , $$\small v_{2,2}$$ or $$\small v_{3,2}$$ is given as positive respectively. If $$\small v_{1,1} = v_{1,2} = 0$$ , $$\small v_{2,1} = v_{2,2} = 0$$ or $$\small v_{3,1} = v_{3,2} = 0$$ then check and make sure that $$\small v_{1,3}$$ , $$\small v_{2,3}$$ or $$\small v_{3,3}$$ is given as positive respectively.

generalfeedback.text:
In order to find the eigenvalues we look at characteristic equation $$\small det(A - \lambda I_{3}) = 0$$ where $$\small I_{3}$$ is a 3x3 identity matrix]

$$\small det(A - \lambda I_{3}) = \begin{vmatrix}-1-\lambda &-8 &-7 \\-9 &-7-\lambda &-1 \\-2 &10 &9-\lambda\end{vmatrix}\: = 0 $$

Solving the determinant we get ,

$$\small \lambda_{1} =-10.9255$$  $$\small \lambda_{2} =-0.83897$$  $$\small \lambda_{3} =12.7644$$

The associated eigenvectors can be calculated as follows:

$$\small (A - \lambda_{1} I_{3})V_{1} = 0$$  ,  $$\small (A - \lambda_{2} I_{3})V_{2} = 0$$  and  $$\small (A - \lambda_{3} I_{3})V_{3} = 0$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{1}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}-1 - (-10.9255) &-8 &-7 \\-9 &-7 - (-10.9255) &-1 \\-2 &10 &9 - (-10.9255) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{1,1} \\v_{1,2} \\v_{1,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}9.9255 &-8 &-7 \\-9 &3.9255 &-1 \\-2 &10 &19.9255\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{1,1} \\v_{1,2} \\v_{1,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{1,1} = \frac{v_{1,1}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{1,2} = \frac{v_{1,2}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{1,3} = \frac{v_{1,3}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{1}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{1} = k_{1}\begin{pmatrix}0.40515\\0.83278\\-0.37728\end{pmatrix}\:$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{2}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}-1 - (-0.83897) &-8 &-7 \\-9 &-7 - (-0.83897) &-1 \\-2 &10 &9 - (-0.83897) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{2,1} \\v_{2,2} \\v_{2,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}-0.16103 &-8 &-7 \\-9 &-6.161 &-1 \\-2 &10 &9.839\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{2,1} \\v_{2,2} \\v_{2,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{2,1} = \frac{v_{2,1}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2 + v_{2,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{2,2} = \frac{v_{2,2}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2 + v_{2,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{2,3} = \frac{v_{2,3}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2 + v_{2,3}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{2}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{2} = k_{2}\begin{pmatrix}0.34739\\-0.62144\\0.70223\end{pmatrix}\:$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{3}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}-1 - (12.7644) &-8 &-7 \\-9 &-7 - (12.7644) &-1 \\-2 &10 &9 - (12.7644) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{3,1} \\v_{3,2} \\v_{3,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}-13.7644 &-8 &-7 \\-9 &-19.7644 &-1 \\-2 &10 &-3.7644\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{3,1} \\v_{3,2} \\v_{3,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{3,1} = \frac{v_{3,1}}{\sqrt{v_{3,1}^{2} + v_{3,2}^2 + v_{3,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{3,2} = \frac{v_{3,2}}{\sqrt{v_{3,1}^{2} + v_{3,2}^2 + v_{3,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{3,3} = \frac{v_{3,3}}{\sqrt{v_{3,1}^{2} + v_{3,2}^2 + v_{3,3}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{3}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{3} = k_{3}\begin{pmatrix}0.53468\\-0.20196\\-0.82056\end{pmatrix}\:$$

generalfeedback.text:
In order to find the eigenvalues we look at characteristic equation $$\small det(A - \lambda I_{3}) = 0$$ where $$\small I_{3}$$ is a 3x3 identity matrix]

$$\small det(A - \lambda I_{3}) = \begin{vmatrix}-4-\lambda &-2 &2 \\-9 &-8-\lambda &-6 \\5 &-6 &-9-\lambda\end{vmatrix}\: = 0 $$

Solving the determinant we get ,

$$\small \lambda_{1} =-14.4859$$  $$\small \lambda_{2} =-8.6395$$  $$\small \lambda_{3} =2.1254$$

The associated eigenvectors can be calculated as follows:

$$\small (A - \lambda_{1} I_{3})V_{1} = 0$$  ,  $$\small (A - \lambda_{2} I_{3})V_{2} = 0$$  and  $$\small (A - \lambda_{3} I_{3})V_{3} = 0$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{1}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}-4 - (-14.4859) &-2 &2 \\-9 &-8 - (-14.4859) &-6 \\5 &-6 &-9 - (-14.4859) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{1,1} \\v_{1,2} \\v_{1,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}10.4859 &-2 &2 \\-9 &6.4859 &-6 \\5 &-6 &5.4859\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{1,1} \\v_{1,2} \\v_{1,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{1,1} = \frac{v_{1,1}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{1,2} = \frac{v_{1,2}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{1,3} = \frac{v_{1,3}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{1}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{1} = k_{1}\begin{pmatrix}0.014455\\-0.66812\\-0.74391\end{pmatrix}\:$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{2}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}-4 - (-8.6395) &-2 &2 \\-9 &-8 - (-8.6395) &-6 \\5 &-6 &-9 - (-8.6395) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{2,1} \\v_{2,2} \\v_{2,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}4.6395 &-2 &2 \\-9 &0.63954 &-6 \\5 &-6 &-0.36046\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{2,1} \\v_{2,2} \\v_{2,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{2,1} = \frac{v_{2,1}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2 + v_{2,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{2,2} = \frac{v_{2,2}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2 + v_{2,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{2,3} = \frac{v_{2,3}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2 + v_{2,3}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{2}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{2} = k_{2}\begin{pmatrix}0.51244\\0.4702\\-0.71855\end{pmatrix}\:$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{3}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}-4 - (2.1254) &-2 &2 \\-9 &-8 - (2.1254) &-6 \\5 &-6 &-9 - (2.1254) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{3,1} \\v_{3,2} \\v_{3,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}-6.1254 &-2 &2 \\-9 &-10.1254 &-6 \\5 &-6 &-11.1254\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{3,1} \\v_{3,2} \\v_{3,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{3,1} = \frac{v_{3,1}}{\sqrt{v_{3,1}^{2} + v_{3,2}^2 + v_{3,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{3,2} = \frac{v_{3,2}}{\sqrt{v_{3,1}^{2} + v_{3,2}^2 + v_{3,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{3,3} = \frac{v_{3,3}}{\sqrt{v_{3,1}^{2} + v_{3,2}^2 + v_{3,3}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{3}$$  can be written as:

generalfeedback.text:
In order to find the eigenvalues we look at characteristic equation $$\small det(A - \lambda I_{3}) = 0$$ where $$\small I_{3}$$ is a 3x3 identity matrix]

$$\small det(A - \lambda I_{3}) = \begin{vmatrix}4-\lambda &8 &-10 \\4 &8-\lambda &-4 \\-6 &-9 &4-\lambda\end{vmatrix}\: = 0 $$

Solving the determinant we get ,

$$\small \lambda_{1} =-3.5111$$  $$\small \lambda_{2} =1.1147$$  $$\small \lambda_{3} =18.3965$$

The associated eigenvectors can be calculated as follows:

$$\small (A - \lambda_{1} I_{3})V_{1} = 0$$  ,  $$\small (A - \lambda_{2} I_{3})V_{2} = 0$$  and  $$\small (A - \lambda_{3} I_{3})V_{3} = 0$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{1}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}4 - (-3.5111) &8 &-10 \\4 &8 - (-3.5111) &-4 \\-6 &-9 &4 - (-3.5111) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{1,1} \\v_{1,2} \\v_{1,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}7.5111 &8 &-10 \\4 &11.5111 &-4 \\-6 &-9 &7.5111\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{1,1} \\v_{1,2} \\v_{1,3} \end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{1,1} = \frac{v_{1,1}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{1,2} = \frac{v_{1,2}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{1,3} = \frac{v_{1,3}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2 + v_{1,3}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{1}$$  can be written as:

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{3}$$ we get,
